comment: Very nice professor and good at what she does.   Gives good feedback on essays.  Put in a decent effort on all of the assignments and you will get an A.
Not another like her. She was one of the best teachers I ever had.

Almost everybody who takes her class, wants to take her again. You can easily get an A in her class just by doing the assignments. She's not hard on grading papers at all. She's also really helpful and nice. I got her for English 1101, 1102, and I'll definitely get her again for my American lit class.

She is definitely one of my best professors. A super nice lady who is always there to help you. It is not hard to make an A in this class. Most of my classmates who had Dr. Nichols for 1101, got her for 1102 too.
Awesome professor, very helpful, great clarity, and extremely fair when grading assignments

Miss class 4 times, SHE DROPS YOU! She is a great TEACHER that is fun, likes to tell stories, and makes the work interesting. There are quite a few essays but nothing that is too demanding. Most were about 3 to 3.5 pages!She is very helpful and encourages you to come to her office. Do bad on an essay and you can re-do and have the grades averaged

She is very helpful. Attendance is mandatory with a few allowed absences before it hurts your grade. She is a little unorthodox but that was the best part. You honestly never know what is going to happen that day. I just wish this wasn't my last engl/lit class needed.

AWESOME. I am not the greatest writer since English is not my first language, but I get A's on my essays. If you go to class everyday, and just follow her direction, you will get it. She is super helpful.
Teacher is super helpful. She is very nice and her class is easy if you do what she says and pay attention. I am not the best writer but with her direction have became an excellent writer.
although that English is not my mother tongue, but this class was a piece of cake because of the professor's way of teaching. she is the best so far.
Good teacher. Clear, but makes you work and think. If you do what she asks and actually try, she will work with you.

Organized and specific about prompts, rubrics, and deadlines. Go to class, follow instructions, do the work, and it's very likely you'll get an A. She's not the easy, laid back type of teacher for English, but you'll actually learn something. I'd totally recommend her and take more of her courses.

She is a great Professor, very helpful and understanding, she makes the subject very interesting, no much homework or any unreasonable assignments. All you have to do is do your readings, which are not that bad comparing to other classes. I would highly recommend it for students who like to learn about literature.

Very understanding and well educated. Even when I wrote a controversial paper, she was reasonable and graded fairly. She gives fun and interesting topics to write about, with enough freedom to keep people interested.

Dr. Michelle Nichols is nothing short of AMAZING! She's very helpful, easily relatable. She's very tolerant, and has a lot of empathy to give. On a scale of 1-10, she's a SOLID 10 both in looks and smarts. SHE'S V-E-R-Y SMART, and has a very good sense of humor. Take her if you know what's good for you. I promise you will not regret it!

Dr. Nichols is very helpful. In our comp class, we had about 4 true essays in the semester. She is always willing to help you review your essay, and she has great flexible office hours. Also, she is younger, so she is easy to relate to. She doesnt mind occasional profanity in your work. Take her, especially if you dont want 100 essays per semester.
She is kind of a slacker in grading. She grades hard but if you do what she says it's all good. If you get a B then you did great in the class!
